articles.title: Finance Ministry plans to scrap curbs on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts, sources say
articles.summary: India's finance ministry is set to remove restrictions on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts. These curbs were imposed in 2020 following border tensions. The move aims to boost commercial ties and address project delays. Several ministries have requested exemptions to overcome constraints. A high-level committee also recommended easing these measures.

articles.title: Leather exports hit by US tariffs: Industry tells Parl panel
articles.summary: The Indian leather industry met with a Parliamentary Standing Committee on Commerce, highlighting that 50% US tariffs are significantly harming exports and impacting the sector's competitiveness. They urged for bilateral engagements to address trade barriers and requested policy and diplomatic support to mitigate socio-economic consequences.

articles.title: India's GDP pegged to grow at 7.4% for FY26 despite tariff heat
articles.summary: India anticipates robust economic growth of 7.4% in fiscal 2025-26. This projection highlights the nation's economic strength despite global challenges. The government's initiatives, including tax relief and GST adjustments, are expected to boost consumer demand. Manufacturing and services sectors are poised for significant expansion, positioning India as a leading economy in Asia.

articles.title: Govt targets to present Seeds Bill in Parliament during Budget session; 9,000 suggestions received: Agri Secretary
articles.summary: Budget session: The government plans to introduce the Seeds Bill 2025 in Parliament in February. This new bill will replace the old Seeds Act of 1966. It aims to ensure seed quality and traceability through mandatory registration. Farmers will still be able to save and exchange their own seeds. The bill also outlines penalties for violations.

articles.title: NITI Aayog calls for fiscal incentives to push development of affordable houses in India
articles.summary: In its report on ‘A Comprehensive Framework to Promote Affordable Housing’, developed jointly with the ministry of housing and urban affairs, the Aayog has proposed a slew of incentives for developers and buyers of affordable houses, including reintroduction of the provision of 100% tax exemption to developers involved in approved affordable housing projects and doubling of loan limit to Rs 40 lakh under the Credit Risk Guarantee Fund Scheme for Low Income Housing.

articles.title: Budget's rare chance: Leveraging the new oil beneath India’s feet
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India possesses significant rare earth reserves, crucial for future industries like EVs and semiconductors. The government is actively promoting this sector through new missions and policy reforms. Budget 2025-26 can further boost rare earth processing and magnet manufacturing. This strategic focus aims to enhance India's economic growth and global influence.

articles.title: Sebi notifies revamped stock brokers’ rules as part of ease of doing business
articles.summary: SEBI has revamped stock broker regulations, allowing them to operate under other financial regulators to enhance ease of doing business. The new Sebi (Stock Brokers) Regulations 2026 simplify norms, reduce word count, and introduce clearer definitions, modernizing the regulatory framework for market intermediaries.

articles.title: Rupee snaps two-day winning run as tariff woes, outflows blunt impact of RBI intervention
articles.summary: The currency, which opened at 89.95 rebounded to 89.75 after RBI intervened for a second straight day, bankers said. It finally ended at 90.0175 after closing at 89.88 on Wednesday.

articles.summary: Higher Education Commission of India Bill will establish a sole authority for coordinating & determining standards in higher education, research, and scientific & technical institutions.

articles.title: Budget 2026: How India can mobilise capital for its next growth leap
articles.summary: Union Budget: Policy and regulatory support helped boost consumption in 2025, reflected in strong GST collections and higher retail credit, aided by income tax relief, GST rate rationalisation and a cumulative 125-basis-point repo rate cut by the RBI. Retail lending led credit growth, while bank credit is expected to grow 11–12% and NBFC/HFC lending 18–19% this fiscal. However, weak deposit mobilisation and sluggish private investment remain concerns.

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: Opening doors for China? Finance Ministry mulls allowing Chinese firms to bid for government contracts: Report
articles.summary: India is considering lifting rules that have barred Chinese firms from government contracts since 2020, a move that could reset commercial engagement as diplomatic tensions ease. The finance ministry is proposing to remove registration and security clearance requirements for bidders from bordering nations, aiming to unblock stalled projects and supply chains.

articles.title: IBBI revamps liquidation forms to cut compliance burden on IPs
articles.summary: The Insolvency Bankruptcy Board of India has introduced new electronic forms for liquidation processes. These revised forms aim to simplify compliance for insolvency professionals and enhance the accuracy of regulatory submissions. The changes will streamline data requirements and utilize technology for auto-population. Four forms, LIQ-1 to LIQ-4, will cover the entire liquidation journey.

articles.title: Grok obscene AI content: X submits response, IT Ministry deems it 'inadequate'
articles.summary: The government has sought more details from X, including specific action taken on obscene content linked to its Grok AI and steps to prevent a repeat in future, sources said on Wednesday, adding that the response submitted by the firm, while detailed, was not adequate.

articles.title: BHEL, ABB, L&T plunge up to 14% after report says govt may scrap curbs on Chinese companies
articles.summary: Shares of BHEL and other capital goods stocks tumbled up to 14% after reports said the Finance Ministry may scrap restrictions on Chinese companies bidding for government contracts. BHEL closed nearly 9% lower, while ABB, Siemens and L&T also declined amid broad market weakness and sharp sector-wide selling.

articles.title: Rupee slides as tariff woes, outflows blunt impact of RBI intervention
articles.summary: The Indian rupee ‍ended lower on Thursday after a ​choppy session as fresh, surprise intervention by the Reserve ⁠Bank of India was outweighed by tariff worries and equity outflows.

articles.title: Russia Sanctions Bill: How may it impact gold, silver, Indian stock market? Explained
articles.summary: According to Republican Senator Lindsey Graham, US President Donald Trump has backed the Russia sanctions bill, which could impose tariffs up to 500% on countries buying Russian oil. Analysts weigh in on potential impacts on gold, silver, and the Indian stock market.

articles.summary: President Trump has greenlit a bipartisan bill authorizing significant sanctions and up to 500% tariffs on countries buying Russian energy. The Sanctioning Russia Act aims to pressure nations like China, India, and Brazil, part of the BRICS block, to cease fueling Russia's war machine.

articles.summary: Industry and policy experts are divided over whether easing customs duties on SEZ domestic clearances will strengthen India’s manufacturing ecosystem or undermine tariff parity, as the debate resurfaces ahead of the Union Budget 2026.

articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: India’s GDP growth estimated at 7.4% in FY26: Government data
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.4% in FY26, surpassing earlier expectations and driven by increased investment and a manufacturing surge. This expansion is expected to push the nation's GDP beyond the $4 trillion mark, supported by accommodative policies and favorable domestic conditions despite global uncertainties.

articles.title: India’s economy to outperform in FY26 with 7.4% growth: HDFC
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth in FY26. Gross Domestic Product is projected to expand by 7.4 percent. This expansion is driven by private consumption and government investment. Services and manufacturing sectors are expected to perform well. Growth is anticipated to moderate in the second half of the fiscal year.

articles.title: Born in a lab, Indian Statistical Institute helped shape new India. A bill intends to alter its future

articles.summary: PRAGATI was launched in 2015 to monitor and review frozen crucial programmes and projects of the central government, and flagged by State governments, for expedited completion

articles.title: Isro will usher in NY with PSLV C62 mission on Monday; will launch surveillance sat EOS-N1, 18 payloads
articles.summary: ISRO's PSLV C62 mission, scheduled for January 12, 2026, will launch the advanced earth observation satellite EOS-N1, enhancing India's surveillance capabilities. The mission also carries a European demonstrator satellite and 17 other payloads, including India's first on-orbit satellite refuelling payload, AayulSAT. This launch marks a significant comeback for the PSLV program after a previous setback.

articles.title: JPMorgan to replace Goldman as Apple Card issuer
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase will replace Goldman Sachs as the issuer of the Apple Card, bringing over $20 billion in balances to its platform. The deal strengthens JPMorgan’s credit card business, while Goldman continues to scale back consumer operations. Completion depends on regulatory approval and is expected in about two years.

articles.title: Google, Character.AI agree to settle suits involving teen suicide
articles.summary: Google and Character.AI have agreed in principle to settle several lawsuits by families alleging AI chatbots harmed children, including a case linked to a teenager’s suicide. The terms remain private and need court approval. The cases intensified global concern over child safety and emotional dependence on AI tools.

articles.title: Introducing guardrails, refining safeguards for Grok, X tells Centre
articles.summary: X has told India it is tightening safeguards on its Grok chatbot after government orders over obscene and unlawful content. Authorities are reviewing the response and warned X could lose legal immunity if it fails to comply. Despite assurances, Grok continued generating explicit material, fuelling global criticism.

articles.title: 500% Trump Tariffs? India could pay the price on Russian oil sanctions while China cruises free
articles.summary: A proposed sanctions bill in the US is set to deliver heavy tariffs on nations importing inexpensive Russian oil. India could face significant repercussions, while China appears insulated from these measures.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Fewer customs duty slabs, simplified tariff structure soon
articles.summary: Union Budget: India plans to simplify its customs duty structure. The government is considering reducing the number of duty slabs to five or six. This move aims to cut down on disputes and make import duties align better with national priorities. The upcoming budget is expected to announce these changes.

articles.title: Grok’s harmful turn shows clear legal gaps in AI regulation
articles.summary: The majority of the regulatory discussion has focused on proposed changes to the IT Rules, which would require platforms to label synthetic content and follow disclosure and tracking measures. Legal experts argue that this approach mainly places the burden on platforms that distribute content, while leaving significant gaps concerning AI tool developers and app stores that enable misuse.

articles.title: Zerodha’s Nithin Kamath explains why tracking lock-in expiries is a must for IPO investors
articles.summary: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath urges IPO investors to track lock-in expiries, warning that post-expiry selling by large shareholders can pressure stocks. He also highlights regulatory limits on broker growth, including SEBI’s 15% open interest cap.

articles.title: Russia sanctions bill may increase US tariffs on India to 500%! What does Lindsey Graham's proposal say?
articles.summary: The Russia sanctions bill has been in the works for months. Senator Lindsey Graham recently said that US President Donald Trump had greenlighted the bill that could cripple Moscow's economy and impose a 500% tariff on countries that buy oil from it, including India.

articles.title: BEL, HAL to Bharat Dynamics: Defence stocks heat up amid US-Venezuela conflict. Should you buy before Budget 2026?
articles.summary: As geopolitical tensions rise with the US's aggressive stance towards Venezuela, defence stocks are gaining traction in India. Experts suggest a focus on long-term growth as the government prepares to increase defence allocations in Budget 2026.

articles.title: Mint Explainer: Why Trump's Venezuela shock is fueling gold, not crude
articles.summary: US action in Venezuela has revived fears over geopolitics, sovereignty, and the safety of paper reserves. While oil prices remain constrained by supply realities, gold is increasingly pricing in a more fragmented and coercive global order.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.summary: MK Surana, former CMD of HPCL, urged caution on the proposed tariff framework, saying its impact will depend on the final wording, the products covered and how it is implemented across countries and contexts.

articles.title: Foreign selling may slow as earnings improve, says Valentis Advisors’ Jyotivardhan Jaipuria
articles.summary: Valentis Advisors’ Jyotivardhan Jaipuria said tariff uncertainty is again weighing on export-oriented stocks as hopes of a trade deal fade. He expects metals to perform over the medium term and said this year could be better for equities due to earnings recovery and lower foreign selling. Jaipuria remains underweight on IT, prefers a selective approach to chemicals, and sees value emerging in parts of the pharma sector.

articles.title: SC asks provident fund body to review ₹15,000 EPF wage ceiling: What it means for salaried employees
articles.summary: Supreme Court directs Centre and EPFO to review the ₹15000 EPF wage ceiling, unchanged since 2014, impacting retirement savings for millions of salaried employees across India.

articles.summary: The curbs, imposed in 2020 after a deadly clash between the countries' troops, required Chinese bidders to register with an Indian government committee and obtain political and security clearances

articles.title: SC Reserves Verdict on Justice Yashwant Varma’s Challenge to LS Inquiry Panel
articles.summary: In a significant legal battle, Justice Varma contends that the parliamentary inquiry into his alleged misconduct is unconstitutional. The Supreme Court's reserved judgment could have far-reaching implications for judicial accountability and the inquiry process.

articles.title: Jharkhand joins Punjab, Karnataka in opposing Centre’s new VB-G RAM G Act
articles.summary: The Jharkhand government has hardened its stance against the Centre’s new rural employment framework, with Chief Minister Hemant Soren warning that any changes undermining wage security, work guarantees and state autonomy could worsen livelihood stress and migration in tribal and rural regions.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: 'Know the rules before you travel’: US consulate issues fresh warning to B1/B2 visa holders — what is it?
articles.summary: The US Consulate General in Mumbai has issued a warning to B1/B2 visitor visa holders regarding unauthorized employment. Engaging in work activities not permitted by the visa can lead to deportation and a potential lifetime ban from entering the United States. Travelers are advised to understand visa regulations before planning their trips.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Customs duty slabs set for big revamp; tariff structure to be simplified
articles.summary: Budget 2026: The government is looking to simplify its customs duty slabs and tariff regime in Union Budget 2026 by cutting labs to five or six, aiming to reduce disputes, streamline imports and align duties with trade and industrial goals.

articles.title: US Auto Market Growth Likely To Ease In 2026
articles.summary: US car sales are expected to slow in 2026 after a tariff- and policy-driven surge in 2025, as weaker consumer confidence and high prices temper demand.

articles.summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts India's GDP growth to slow to 6.8 percent in FY27. Inflation is expected to rise, restricting the Reserve Bank's ability to lower interest rates. Private investment remains subdued. The rupee's depreciation is likely nearing its end. The current account deficit is projected at 1 percent in 2026. Budget 2026-27 can unlock this 'power-lifter' role by investing in agri-logistics and predictable trade policies, transforming a managed sector into a strategic asset.

articles.title: Synthetic mint dents India's grip on global mentha market

Farmers are shifting to other crops as demand for natural mentha wanes. Bulk buyers now prefer the synthetic version for its consistent quality and lower cost. This trend threatens the future of India's natural mint farming.

articles.title: Should you get screened for breast cancer annually? New study by US scientists suggests better approach
articles.summary: US researchers conducted a trial of over 28,000 women aged 40-74 to find an effective way of distributing breast cancer screening resources. Results published in JAMA on 12 Dec.

articles.title: From new year, NTA to verify candidates in NEET, JEE & other entrance exams with facial recognition
articles.summary: Aadhaar card will be used for verification. Decision taken after a small trial at some exam centres for NEET-UG this year.

articles.title: Jamia suspends professor over question on ‘atrocities against Muslims in India’ in semester exam paper
articles.summary: New Delhi: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) has suspended a professor from its department of social work over a question he set on “atrocities against Muslims in India” in a semester exam paper. According to university officials, there were complaints over a question in the BA (Hons) Social Work first-semester examination held earlier this week in […]

articles.title: UGC tells universities to prevent entry of stray dogs in campus, calls for ’round-the-clock vigil’
articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Parsis to Tibetans, India ‘safe haven’ for ‘persecuted communities’ for centuries—new Class 7 NCERT book
articles.summary: Previous NCERT social science textbooks didn't have such a chapter. No connection to CAA controversy, says NCERT director.
